dcterms:creator: Y. LeCun
L. Bottou
Y. Bengio
P. Haffner
dcterms:description: The MNIST dataset consists of handwritten digits and is commonly used for training various image processing systems. In this paper, it is used to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed l1/l2 pseudo-norm method in inducing sparsity in convolutional layers.
dcterms:title: MNIST

dcterms:creator: K. Simonyan
A. Zisserman
dcterms:description: CIFAR-10 is a dataset of 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 different classes, used for evaluating the performance of image classification algorithms. In this paper, it is utilized to assess the proposed method's ability to reduce the number of filters in convolutional layers while maintaining accuracy.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-10
